ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detector (EPEAD) electron fluxes data with energy >2 MeV. at 16 s Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) are essentially the same as the Energetic Particle Sensor (EPS) on GOES 8-12. There are two EPEADs on each satellite, one looking east and one looking west. For more information, please see T. G. Onsager et al. (1996), Operational uses of the GOES energetic particle detectors, in GOES-8 and Beyond, Proc. SPIE, Vol. 2812, edited by E. R. Washwell, pp. 281-290, Bellingham, WA. These data file contain mainly information on the electron fluxes with energy with >2 MeV from both the A and B detectors. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA-Office of Space Science Applications (United States); NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States); Dr. Terry G. Onsager

InformationURL.Name: GOES N, O, and P Brochure
InformationURL.Description: Information about the magnetometers onboard GOES 13.

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors data in CSV format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g13_epead_e2ew_16s_20080301_20080301.csv, indicates goes 13 magnetometer data at 16 s resolution from start of March 1, 2008 to the end of March 1, 2008.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NASA; NOAA; Dr. Terry G. Onsager

TimeSpan.Note: Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags. Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

NumericalData.Keyword: Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for electrons with energy >2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of electrons with energy with >2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts per second of electrons with energy >2 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove proton contamination.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of electrons with energy with >2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of electrons with energy >2 Mev from the East facing detector with no correction applied to remove proton contamination.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for electrons with energy >2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of electrons with energy with >2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts per second of electrons with energy >2 MeV from the A detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove proton contamination.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of electrons with energy with >2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of electrons with energy >2 Mev from the A detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove proton contamination.
